meanings.definition: The state or quality of being simultaneous.
meanings.sent1: The simultaneousnesses of the dancers' movements impressed the audience.
meanings.sent2: The simultaneousnesses of the traffic lights turning green caused a smooth flow of cars.
meanings.sent3: The simultaneousnesses of the cats meowing in harmony made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The simultaneousnesses of the stars twinkling in the night sky created a magical atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The simultaneousnesses of the students raising their hands made the teacher's job easier.

meanings.definition: The occurrence of two or more events at the same time.
meanings.sent1: The concert's simultaneousnesses with the fireworks display made it a memorable night.
meanings.sent2: The simultaneousnesses of the thunder and lightning indicated an approaching storm.
meanings.sent3: The simultaneousnesses of the birds chirping and the church bells ringing added to the peaceful ambiance.
meanings.sent4: The simultaneousnesses of the waves crashing against the shore and the seagulls flying overhead painted a picturesque scene.
meanings.sent5: The simultaneousnesses of the clock striking midnight and the fireworks lighting up the sky marked the beginning of the new year.
